name: The Crane Residential Resort

reviews.title: good but not great
reviews.text: Just returned from The Crane. Have stayed on West Coast for five years and thought many of hotels tired.

reviews.title: Stayed one night then moved to the Hilton
reviews.text: Due to construction, we secured a very reasonable deal for Junior Garden Suite at the Crane. Rooms good size and clean. Had a problem with DVD player and safe but this was fixed within a day. Disappointed by both restaurants. Considering that this is 5 star, the food could have been better and it is not cheap! All the staff are fabulous, especially Sammy who arranges all the flowers about the hotel. He is so happy and talented and cheered me up every day. The new general manager is very switched on and is improving things daily. My biggest concern with the whole hotel is safety for children.. I watched as two children of about 12 and 9 were climbing aroung the turetted pool with open sides 4 floors up!! When this was mentioned to the staff, they quickly informed the parents, but did mention it had been a problem before. The ground floor private pools have no security if you are in your apartment. They fall directly off the edge of the terrace with no protection or any way of putting any in. There is no nightlife at all and most people seem to eat in their apartments, which are very comfortable with huge satelite TVs and good facilities. They need a shop on site for basic goods as the trip to Emerald City supermarket is a pain. If you take the hotel bus, you could be there for ages. Take the bus there and the number of taxi company to come back. The food is also expensive surprisingly. This hotel is all about the fabulous beach which is breathtaking.. After getting used to 300 steps each way, you appreciate the cool breeze -it can get extremely hot by the pool.

reviews.title: Pretty and peaceful
reviews.text: When we arrived at The Crane in Sep 05, we pulled up to an average looking place. The lobby was very small. The pool was about 1/4 the size they made it look on the website. The room was very nice, mahogany furniture, HUGE bathroom. It was almost bigger than the bedroom. There was soap scum remnants on the shower door other than that the room was very clean. The plunge pool was ICE cold with no heater. Our ocean view over looked the construction site where they were expanding the hotel and a sliver of ocean. The air conditioner was out in almost all of the buildings. We tried to sleep with the ceiling fan on and all covers off and were still sweating. You couldn't open the window because you would get eaten alive by the mosquitos. We notified the front desk that our air was out and they informed us we were in the only building (building 2) where it was supposedly working. I am very cold natured so it doesn't take much to cool me down. We went back to the room and felt the vent, the air was barely cooler than room temp.

reviews.title: Romantic
reviews.text: The beach was gorgeous! Lots and lots of white sand. Beautiful blue water. The restaurant was very hot. We were sweating while we were eating. Not sure if it was because their air conditioner was broke as well or if it is just an open air dining place. The food was good, we ate on the Asian side.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005
reviews.text: We decided to check out the morning of our second day. The front desk was very understanding and refunded the remainder of our stay. Had it not been for the construction and the air. We would have stayed and am sure would have had a wonderful time. However, we checked out and went to the Hilton which was gorgeous!! They felt bad for our ordeal and upgraded our room to the tower level with free cocktails and continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.title: Loved this place
reviews.text: Well first off I would have to say this place was amazing, perfect place for a honeymoon or just a romantic vaca. I went the the crane in August and stayed in a junior suite, lots of space and away from the construction so I had no problems. I will say that food at the resturants sucked, I am a chef and I was discusted with the type of food they were trying to pull off for being a luxury spot. I actually made some recommendations and continue to talk with the property manager about the food in the resturants. I stayed for 8 days and found that there was plenty to do on the island, especially the sunset cruises and day cruises with snorkel. Beautiful island minus bridgetown which was nasty and dirty and quite boring but every other little parish had its great parts and nightlife especially the GAP. Anyway I took my girlfriend here for her birthday and she loved it and she is very picky. Unfortunately she broke up with me a month after our visit but I guess that doesnt make and sense to mention. Anyway try this place out and enjoy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: i was a little bit concerned b4 arrival after reading a few negative reveiws on the crane hotel, but from the moment i arrived there was hardly any noise from the construction, & i was very impressed, everything went like clockwork, from being greeted by the doorstaff, to reception & concierge desk`s, & shown to my accomadation, handcarved mahogany fourposter bed, hugh jaccuzi very impressed with the rooms & the service & the restaurants & the pool, everything i asked for & expected was there, the lovely pool, the beach, a day out with coolrunnnings, the catarmaran company,(booked through concierge) swimming with the sea turtles great food & crew, they only take 15/18 passengers,(booked through concierge) so lots of service & food & drinks included, i must also strongly reccomend going to the plantation to see the bajan back to the roots show, it was very slick & a very spectactcular live show, mini-bus & food & drink all included, peter the driver is also the steel band drummer, went to oistins harbour fish market, approx 3000 people attended this open air music festival on the friday night 19:00hrs-02:00hrs, fresh fish cooked & drinks,

Crane ...a work in progress!
reviews.text: My wife and I were just at the Crane this May 2007. It is NOT a real hotel but actually a collection of time shares. The entire complex is under construction. The totally new buildings are under construction 7 days a week. The management is trying to rent out space in incomplete facilities that are very nice but lacking in details. For example No Airconditioning! Ocean views which include the trucks and cranes distributing rocks on the "hotel" property.

reviews.text: The european restaurant is just ok , the Japanese / Thai facility is much better. The hotel is very isolated. It costs about $100 US to travel to the west side each way. It costs $25 US to take a taxi to the local supermarket. There is no ATM on site, another cab ride.

reviews.text: My husband and I were there in February 2006, sorry to have taken so long to write this review, but felt the need to post it even at this late date. The property was under extensive construction at the time we were there. Jackhammers etc. beginning at 7:00 AM daily, though we were told upon check in it would begin at 8:00 AM Monday, Wednesday and Friday. At the time we made our reservations through Expedia, no information was posted about the property being under expansion. Totally unhappy with the way was handled by staff and management. Also agree that the food was limited at The Crane. It was very expensive to go to the more built up side of the island for what was even there poor quality food for the price. We spent well over there for a week what we spent for 10 days on a trip to Italy.......Would not recommend traveling to Barbados and definitely not The Crane.

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Let me start by saying that the property that The Crane resort is on is nothing short of magnificent. Just walking around the property is gorgeous, with amazing landscaping and small wildlife everywhere (frogs, koi, anoles, birds, snails etc). The pools (there are at least 5 or 6, plus a tremendous hot tub) are beautiful. The beach, and the views of the beach and ocean from the cliffs is amazing. The entire resort functions as a sort of gated community with a guard booth at the entrance which lends an exclusive feel to the grounds. Upon arrival they park your car for you and arrange for your bags to be brought to your room, provide you with a complimentary rum punch and start your check in with a guided walk to your room. On to the cons.... many of the past reviews we had read mentioned the rather aloof staff.... we ended up finding this to be spot on. Several times when we called the front desk with an issue (such as waiting for our bags to arrive at our room for 1 1/2 hours ) and got no answer at the front desk, finally giving up we walked down to the desk where we were told they were on their way.... another 1/2 hour later they arrived. The poor guy was covered in sweat and clearly delivering all the bags by himself which makes the delay understandable however the front desk not answering the phone and having to walk down there only to find the front desk staffed by three people who all appeared to be capable of answering a phone was annoying. By no means am I implying that the staff was anything but very nice when we spoke to them (including any staff we passed on the walkways and other parts of the hotel) but aloof was definitely the best way to describe them. On to our room.... the decor was quite nice and if everything worked correctly it would have been a lovely room. However, the a/c while quite loud, did very little to actually cool the room, the shower leaked out onto the bathroom floor so much that we constantly had to have several towels on the floor to soak it up, and the floor bolts on the patio doors required a lot of manipulation to engage as the doors were pretty warped. Overall the room really seemed rather run down. The restaurants may all have been quite nice but having only dined at one (The Carriage House) I can't comment on the the other three other than that the menu was rather expensive and all required reservations for all meals. Our meal at the carriage house was average at best with nothing about the food being worth the cost. Unfortunately with only high end restaurants on premise if you don't want to have to make reservations for breakfast then you are left with going off premise for breakfast or picking up food to cook in your room (this was the option we chose and I will say that having a kitchen in the room was very convenient). In writing this review I don't want to infer that the resort was not quite nice in many ways but given the overall cost per night It could have been so much better and when we eventually return to Barbados we will most likely be trying one of the other luxury resorts.
reviews.title: exquisite

Unfortunately one of the building workers cut the power to all of building 5. Initially this was a 2 hour delay, became a 4 hour delay and ended up being a 7 hour delay well into the evening. The annoying part was the mishandling by the front desk staff, no offer of a drink at the bar, minimal apologies, the best that could be done was to offer a candle and apologise for the heat. We ended up complaining to the hotel manager and received a new room, overlooking the construction, but much larger (didn't think that was possible) and a plunge pool (very lovely).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of 4 just returned from a spectacular 1 week stay at the Crane. We loved the people, amenities, accommodations, and restaurants. Most impressive were the staff. Everyone we encountered was friendly and made us feel welcome. Guest relations staff were very helpful with arranging our surf lessons and hiring a car. We especially appreciated the extra attention provided by Jeanine at the front desk, Grantley (bell hop), and Dianna from housekeeping Building 5 (who genuinely wanted us to to make sure that we had a great experience in Barbados)!
reviews.title: Excellent property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are leaving The Crane tomorrow and we're sad to go. Kind of feel like I'm leaving home. We stayed in possibly the best room you can have. Plenty of space... clean facilities... well kept grounds for a place that's been established in the 1800s. Very charming. Make sure you explore the grounds... the gardens... sit at the waterfront and watch the moon rise out of the ocean and the clouds brush the sky from the horizon over you. Listen to the waves crashing on the rocks below. Wake up before dawn and move to the balcony with your blanket to lay on a lounge chair... feel the soft wind and let the sound of the ocean waves rock you to sleep. In an hour or two you'll wake up with the sun kissing your face and warming you in your blanket with the gentle hush of the waves crashing in the foreground.

Beware !!!!!
reviews.text: We never actually made it to The Crane..just beware...they quoted us incorrect rates on our email and then when we sent in to confirm they said ooops and would not honour their mistake. We made our flight arrangements based on the information they gave us and now we are madly searching for something else since the ooops is double the original quote. I work with the public every day and if myself or one of my reps mis-quoted someone we would stand by our error. They emailed us back offering us 25% off some other rooms and indicated that the rooms we requested were now fully booked, what a coincidence. Be very careful dealing with the Crane,,dot your i's and cross your t's or you will be ripped off.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at The Crane
reviews.text: We stayed at the The Crane Resort for a week May25- June 1 and LOVED it. The physical beauty of the resort is amazing. The overlooks and secluded gardens with sculptures are so peaceful. We stayed in building 4 and the views from our one bedroom ocean view could not be beat. I booked the Best of Barbados package from CheapCaribbean.com that included the huge gourmet breakfast buffet. It was an amazing deal and we will be using them again as everything was just as promised. The staff at the Crane were very helpful and efficient. They handled all problems quickly and even sent us flowers to our room for our 25th anniversary. You do not see that kind of attention to detail at most large resorts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were not affected by the construction staying in building 4. We could hear it in the background but it did not affect our relaxing by the pools. The new pool complex with the two large jacuzzi's were a daily stop and the Carriage house pool bar the perfect place to get a cold Banks beer to watch the sunset. Although it was quite hot we had a constant breeze blowing through our room that kept us quite comfortable sleeping at night with our windows and doors wide up. I could imagine being on the back side of the building could get hot as it has a chiller A/C and it does not get as cold.

Afternoon tea in L'Azzure is well worth a visit, álong with the Gospel Breakfast on a Sunday.

reviews.text: i visited the crane with the intention of having a relaxing couple of days away from the city bustle - boy did it live up to expectations!! the view was fantastic, room lovely, food delicious (though i would've expected nothing less with their reputation), and service very good - wonderful staff...a few asides - the breakfast menu was a bit too paltry, and if they do have a buffet breakfast option, it certainly was not made known to me...maybe more pillows for the bed and a working jacuzzi?...but all in all - definitely a place worth staying at and i do intend to return in the near future..

excellent hotel great staff excellent accommodation
reviews.text: We have just stayed at the Crane for 1 week they couldn't do enough to make our stay special, we went with our children (2 year old and 3 year old) and the staff were excellent with them. Our room was fantastic it was a home from home, the construction work that was going on didn't affect our time there. We can not fault this hotel, the pool was fantastic the beach was out of this world and the views were amazing, we stayed in block 5 (546a) which had a plunge pool and a view of the sea we couldn't ask for more. We dealt with Sophie and Alexander who certainly made our stay extra special. Thanks again to everyone there you were the best and would definately go back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: I had a fantastic time at the Crane, once I arrived and saw the amazing pool overlooking the ocean and one of the best beaches in Barbados I knew I wouldn't be leaving the hotel much. The room was absolutely beautiful with a huge bed and fabulous bathroom with spa bath.

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and helped make my trip so much nicer. Both restaurants were lovely with Zen having a fantastic internal design. Although I would say the Sunday Buffet is over priced and I wouldn't recommend it, but this is a very slight criticism.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: First of all, i will say we had a nice week at the crane. Definately the resort is old but has alot of charm. The only real problem we had was the air conditioner. We stayed in a 1 bedroom oceanfront suite with private pool. Our room was very nice ; just HOT!
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: I mentioned it 3 different days to 3 different members of the stay and was promised it would be checked out. The maid said it was as good as it gets . The temperature was well above 80 in our room 95% of the time. Our suite was missing several key items such as blender, toaster alarm clock. It took 3 days to get these items. The staff was always very friendly except at lunch on thursday the dining staff were all non-emotional, not rude, just not too pleasant to be around. Construction was definately visible, but was never really an issue for us. We knew in advance about the construction. I think if we would have had a cooler room it would have been great. I guess these problems are common with time-share properties. The beach was beautiful! The pool was nice but the water was very COLD! Not sure if i would go back, not because it was that bad, but there are many resorts much better.
reviews.title: The Fawlty Towers of Barbados

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We spent much time in selecting the right place to stay for our two week stay in Barbados, and after reading numerous reviews on The Crane and visiting their website we decided this was the dream destination. We discounted the poor reviews, believing only the good ones, what a mistake.
reviews.title: Loved The Crane!
Disaster Vacation
reviews.text: On arrival at the Hotel the porter/doorman grudgingly removed our cases from the car and just managed to point us in the direction of the check in clerk. Check in took 20 mins and we were then given complimentary vouchers to have a Rum Punch while the receptionist checked to see if our room was ready. A charming young man saw us to our room which was in the historic old building. The lounge, bedroom and bathroom were large with very high ceilings and natural airconditioning (open the widows, close the shutters and you get a continual breeze through the room) . There was also a ceiling fan in the lounge and bedroom. We also had a small kitchen area. The rugs in the lounge and bedroom were soaking wet and took two days to dry out. One of the window shutters was broken and could not be closed. After a week and two requests to have it repaired a bodged job was done, but unfortunately the securing bar was two inches too wide and on checking out two weeks later the problem had still not been resolved. When it rained part of the bedroom flooded as the guttering has been removed from the adjacent balcony.

reviews.title: Crane Vs. Crane
reviews.text: Trying to get to sleep was an experience,the noise of the crickets throughout the night was unbearable, luckily we had some earplugs which we had to use every night of our stay in order to sleep. These also meant you could not hear the mosquitoes which bit my wife continually, I was lucky they left me alone.

description: Perched dramatically on the cliffs of Barbados' pristine south-east coast, The Crane Residential Resort, established since 1887, is the island's oldest operating hotel. Transformed into a world-class luxury resort, The Crane features ultra-spacious, fully appointed ocean-view one & two bedroom suites and three bedroom Penthouses, many with their own private plunge-pool. Facilities include the acclaimed Zen Restaurant serving classic Thai and Japanese cuisine and the consistently popular L'Azure Restaurant. The casual Carriage House Pool Side restaurant is another favourite along with D'Onofrio's Trattoria located in 'The Village' which offers duty free shopping, a General Store, Bar 1887 (with nightly live entertainment) and The Village Cafe. Last but not least is Crane Beach voted by Lifestyle's of The Rich and Famous as one of the Top Ten most beautiful beaches in the world, now with a fabulous Beach Grill!
